title: 2 Samuel Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Samuel with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 24 chapters.

questions.question: Who came to David with news of Saul and Jonathan's death?
questions.explanation: An Amalekite came out of the camp from Saul to report the deaths of Saul and Jonathan to David.

questions.question: What did David do when he heard of Saul and Jonathan's death?
options: He rent his clothes and mourned
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes and mourned
questions.explanation: David took hold of his clothes and rent them, and he and his men mourned, wept, and fasted for Saul, Jonathan, and Israel.

questions.question: What did David call the place where Uzzah died?
questions.explanation: After Uzzah touched the ark and was struck down by God, David named the place Perezuzzah which means 'the breach of Uzzah.'

questions.question: Why was Uzzah struck down by God?
options: He touched the ark of God
questions.correctAnswer: He touched the ark of God
questions.explanation: Uzzah put forth his hand to steady the ark when the oxen stumbled, which was against God's command, and God struck him dead.

questions.question: Who was Bathsheba's husband before David took her?
questions.explanation: Bathsheba was the wife of Uriah the Hittite before David took her and she became pregnant.

questions.question: What strategy did David use to have Uriah killed?
options: He sent Uriah to the front lines and withdrew support
questions.correctAnswer: He sent Uriah to the front lines and withdrew support
questions.explanation: David instructed Joab to place Uriah where the battle was fiercest and then withdraw troops so Uriah would be killed.

questions.question: How did David respond when Michal criticized his dancing before the ark?
options: He said it was before the LORD and would continue
questions.correctAnswer: He said it was before the LORD and would continue
questions.explanation: David told Michal he was playing before the LORD who chose him to be ruler, and he would be even more humble in future.

questions.question: How long did the ark remain in the house of Obededom the Gittite?
questions.explanation: The ark stayed in Obededom's house for three months and the LORD blessed him and his household during that time.

questions.question: Who was appointed over the king's house after Abner's death?
questions.explanation: Baanah and Rechab, captains of Ish-Bosheth's army, murdered Ish-Bosheth and brought his head to David.

questions.question: What was David's reaction to the murderers of Ish-Bosheth?
questions.explanation: David condemned their murder and had Baanah and Rechab executed for killing a righteous man in his own house.

questions.question: Who was Mephibosheth?
options: Jonathan's son who was lame in both feet
questions.correctAnswer: Jonathan's son who was lame in both feet
questions.explanation: Mephibosheth was Jonathan's son, who was lame in both feet, and David showed kindness to him.

questions.question: What was the cause of David's sin with Bathsheba according to 2 Samuel 11?
options: David stayed in Jerusalem while his army went to war
questions.correctAnswer: David stayed in Jerusalem while his army went to war
questions.explanation: David remained in Jerusalem instead of going to battle, which led to him seeing Bathsheba and committing adultery.

questions.question: What was Nathan the prophet's message to David after his sin with Bathsheba?
options: David's sin was forgiven without consequences
David would face severe consequences including death in his family
David should immediately abdicate the throne
questions.correctAnswer: David would face severe consequences including death in his family
questions.explanation: Nathan told David that his sin displeased God and his household would suffer turmoil and death as a consequence.

questions.question: How did David respond when Nathan confronted him about his sin?
questions.explanation: David acknowledged his sin and repented before the LORD after Nathan's rebuke.

questions.question: Which son of David died as a result of the consequences of his sin with Bathsheba?
questions.explanation: The infant born to David and Bathsheba became ill and died as part of the consequences of David's sin.

questions.question: Who was Absalom?
options: David's son who rebelled against him
questions.correctAnswer: David's son who rebelled against him
questions.explanation: Absalom was one of David's sons who later led a rebellion against his father.

questions.question: What was the cause of the feud between Amnon and Absalom?
options: Amnon's assault on Tamar, Absalom's sister
questions.correctAnswer: Amnon's assault on Tamar, Absalom's sister
questions.explanation: Amnon raped his sister Tamar, which led Absalom to seek revenge and eventually kill Amnon.

questions.question: Where did Absalom flee after killing Amnon?
questions.explanation: After killing Amnon, Absalom fled to Geshur, where he stayed for three years.

questions.question: How did David react to Absalom's rebellion initially?
questions.explanation: David fled Jerusalem to avoid confrontation with Absalom and mourned the strife in his family.

questions.question: Who was the loyal friend that helped David during Absalom's rebellion?
questions.explanation: Hushai pretended to support Absalom but secretly worked to undermine his plans and aid David.

questions.question: What happened to Absalom in the battle against David's forces?
options: He was caught by his hair in a tree and killed
questions.correctAnswer: He was caught by his hair in a tree and killed
questions.explanation: Absalom's hair got caught in an oak tree, and Joab killed him despite David's orders to spare him.

questions.question: Who killed Absalom against David's wishes?
questions.explanation: Joab ignored David's command to spare Absalom and killed him during the battle.

questions.question: What was David's reaction when he heard of Absalom's death?
questions.explanation: David grieved for his son Absalom and lamented his death despite the rebellion.

questions.question: How did David show kindness to Mephibosheth?
options: He restored his grandfather Saul's lands and gave him a place at the king's table
questions.correctAnswer: He restored his grandfather Saul's lands and gave him a place at the king's table
questions.explanation: David showed kindness to Jonathan's son Mephibosheth by restoring Saul's lands and allowing him to eat at the king's table.

questions.question: What was the sin of David recorded in 2 Samuel 24?
options: David numbered the people of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: David numbered the people of Israel
questions.explanation: David sinned by ordering a census of Israel, which displeased God and brought punishment.

questions.question: How did God punish Israel for David's census?
questions.explanation: God sent a plague on Israel that killed seventy thousand men as punishment for the census.

questions.question: Where did David build an altar to stop the plague caused by his census?
options: The threshingfloor of Araunah the Jebusite
questions.correctAnswer: The threshingfloor of Araunah the Jebusite
questions.explanation: David built an altar on Araunah's threshingfloor to offer sacrifices and stop the plague.

questions.question: Who advised David to build an altar on the threshingfloor to end the plague?
questions.explanation: The prophet Gad instructed David to build an altar on the threshingfloor to stop the plague.

questions.question: What did David insist on doing to Araunah's offering at the threshingfloor?
options: Buying it for full price and offering a sacrifice himself
questions.correctAnswer: Buying it for full price and offering a sacrifice himself
questions.explanation: David refused to offer burnt offerings to the LORD that cost him nothing and paid full price for the threshingfloor and oxen.

questions.question: True or False: David danced before the LORD with all his might wearing royal robes.
questions.explanation: David danced before the LORD with all his might wearing a linen ephod, not royal robes.

questions.question: True or False: Michal, Saul's daughter, had children after marrying David.
questions.explanation: Michal had no children until the day of her death.

questions.question: True or False: David was afraid of the LORD after the death of Uzzah.
questions.explanation: David was afraid of the LORD because of the breach caused by Uzzah's death near the ark.

questions.question: True or False: David immediately brought the ark of God into the city of David after it was taken from Obededom's house.
questions.explanation: After hearing the LORD blessed Obededom's household, David brought up the ark with gladness into the city of David.

questions.question: True or False: David appointed Absalom as his successor before Absalom rebelled.
questions.explanation: David never appointed Absalom as his successor, and Absalom rebelled against him.

questions.question: True or False: Joab was loyal to David throughout the entire book of 2 Samuel without question.
questions.explanation: Joab was generally loyal but disobeyed David's orders by killing Absalom against David's wishes.

questions.question: True or False: David numbered the people of Israel upon the urging of his military commanders.
questions.explanation: The Bible states that the LORD incited David to number Israel, not his commanders.

questions.question: True or False: David honored Jonathan's memory by showing kindness to Mephibosheth.
questions.explanation: David showed kindness to Jonathan's son Mephibosheth for Jonathan's sake.

questions.question: True or False: David's lament for Saul and Jonathan includes the phrase 'How are the mighty fallen!'
questions.explanation: David's lament includes the phrase 'How are the mighty fallen!' mourning Saul and Jonathan.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty ______!'
questions.explanation: David lamented that the mighty were slain and fallen in battle.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'David danced before the LORD with all his _______'
questions.explanation: David danced with all his might before the LORD when bringing up the ark.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy _____; for thy mouth hath testified against thee.'
questions.explanation: David declared the blood of the Amalekite was on his own head because he claimed to have killed the LORD'S anointed.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest _______, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.'
questions.explanation: David instructed Joab to place Uriah in the front of the hottest battle to ensure his death.

questions.question: Who was David's commander who killed Absalom?
questions.explanation: Joab was David's general who killed Absalom despite David's order to spare him.

questions.question: What was the name of the man who falsely claimed to have killed Saul?
questions.explanation: An Amalekite claimed he killed Saul and brought his crown and bracelet to David.

questions.question: What was David's reason for not going to battle when kings went out in 2 Samuel 11?
options: The text does not provide a reason
He was busy with state affairs
questions.correctAnswer: The text does not provide a reason
questions.explanation: The scripture simply states David tarried at Jerusalem but does not give a specific reason.
